main event: A witness observed a brilliant white incandescent object in the sky that changed to pale red on 7 March 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as being ten times brighter than a typical star., The object was visible for about 5-10 minutes., The witness called attention to the object, indicating it was exceptionally bright., The reporting officer speculated that the sighting was likely caused by the planet Venus., There was no radar contact reported during the sighting.
sighted object: a brilliant white incandescent object changing to pale red
witness description: One witness who observed the object changing colors.
